Pass the SALT 2020
June 29-July 1 — Lille, France


Free Software & Security
> talks and workshops
> free event as in free beer

CORONAVIRUS - COVID 19 Statement

Contents


Conferences

Talks will be about Free Software and Security. All the talks shall be given in English. The 2019 edition hosted 26 talks, grouped in 7 sessions.

Workshops

2019 Pass the SALT hosted 9 workshops to discover new security free software projects. Network, theat intel and IAM.
Come to discover and practice!

Networking

Exchange experiences and create new relationships with open minded attendees or speakers in a warm and open-minded ambiance.

More information: look at some previous speakers and some collaborations born during the conference.


The team

Pass the SALT 2018 organization team

Pass the SALT is brought to you by a small but enthusiast and dedicated team:
core team : @cbrocas, @doegox, @follc and @moutane
on-site volunteers: @eloisebrocas, @acervoise, @cdpointpoint, @PapaZours and @Sebdraven
local Polytech contact: Benjamin Richez
video team: @ubicast_video

Timeline

2020 Pass the SALT has currently reached this stage:

November, 2019: announcement of the 2020 edition
January, 2020: opening of the Call For Papers
March 31, 2020: closing of the Call For Paper
April 15, 2020: notification to the speakers
April 30, 2020: publication of the program
Mid May, 2020: opening of the booking interface
(entrance is free but due to the capacity of the room, booking is required).
June 29 to July 1, 2020 : the conference :-)

Your Feedback



Orange Tsaï, principal security researcher at DEVCORE.
Best server side bug of @PwnieAwards 2019 winner with @mehqq_.

Ange Albertini, security reasearcher at Google.
Member of the team which broke SHA-1.

D4 project led by the CIRCL team, the CERT LU for private sector.

@H_Miser, IR engineer at CERT Société Générale.
Smart speakers on stage
and packed room of focused attendees
Come and exchange extensively with developers of top OSS projects !
or just enjoy the moment with new and/or old friends :)
Attendees often provide a funny atmosphere ...
... usually welcomed by our open minded speakers ;-)
